item.name: Quiver of the Verdant Hunt
entries: This living quiver is woven from ancient vines and thrums with primal magic. It produces its own arrows and can imbue them with powerful hunting magic.

entries.name: Infinite Arrows
entries: Whenever this quiver is empty, it magically creates nonmagical arrows. These arrows disappear after hitting or missing a target.
Arrows drawn from the quiver count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity only when empowered by one of the quiver's charges.

entries.name: Verdant Charges
entries: The quiver has 10 charges and regains {@dice 1d8 + 2} expended charges daily at dawn.
When you draw an arrow, you may expend charges to imbue it with one of the effects below. You choose the effect when the arrow is drawn.
Saving throw DC = 10 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.

items.name: Entangling Shot (1 charge).
items.entry: On a hit, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the end of its next turn. Large or larger creatures have advantage on this saving throw.

items.name: Knockdown Shot (1 charge).
items.entry: On a hit, the target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is already prone, it instead takes an extra {@dice 1d8} bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Stunning Shot (2 charges).
items.entry: On a hit, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target's speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Crippling Shot (1 charge).
items.entry: On a hit, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls and its speed reduced by 10 feet for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

items.name: Hunter's Marked Arrow (2 charges).
items.entry: On a hit, the target is affected by the {@spell hunter's mark} spell without requiring concentration. The effect ends early if you use this property again on another creature.
